TFW he's not even a Fire/Dragon >_>

Way back in the day of Generation 1, Charizard, Garydos, and the Dratini line were all considered to be dragon type, however, Charizard, was changed to Fire/Flying because it was deemed rather unfair to have a Dragon type starter, and Garydos was changed to Water/Flying because, evolving at level 20, would be too early on to gain access to a dragon type. No other generation 1 pokemon look enough like a dragon to pass as a dragon type, so they just left it at 3 Dragon types all in the same evolutionary line

Oh god, I don't even remember why having a Dragon Type is so strong...
It's been a long time lol

fixed that for you

For anyone who doesn't know, it's hinted at in the lore that LeBlanc is using her illusion magic to impersonate Jarvan, and that the real one is either being held prisoner in Noxus, or is dead.
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/ef/8e/54/ef8e54126eabdcc09fac3b4f910cfb19.jpg
The reflection of Jarvan {{champion:59}} on Bird-Swain's {{champion:50}}  neck thing is LeBlanc {{champion:7}}.

And this is in LeBlanc's lore page on the League wiki:
> 
> LEBLANC: "I haven't had the pleasure of your company for some time, Grand General".
> 
> SWAIN: "You have my favor. That is enough".
> 
> LEBLANC: "And yet, I suspect you're here to seek the Black Rose's assistance once more".
> 
> SWAIN: "The blood of the Jarvan IV Demacian prince. How much remains"?
> 
> LEBLANC: "After the last charade? Enough that you should be very mindful of how you use it. Whatever you intend had best be brief".
> 
> SWAIN: "No chicanery this time; my need for subtlety is nearing its end. I must secure my position with bloodshed, and that requires a blunt instrument".
> 
> LEBLANC: "It sounds as if you have one in mind".
> 
> SWAIN: "Let me show you".
Wow I never knew or saw that before. That's pretty interesting considering how the Black Rose group is pretty entrenched in secret politics.
